results.name: a(n) = x(w+1) where x(0) = 0 and x(k+1) = 2^(k+1)-1-x(k) (resp. x(k)) when d_k = 1 (resp. d_k <> 1) and Sum_{k=0..w} d_k*3^k is the ternary representation of n. Sequence A332498 gives corresponding y's.
comment: The representation of {(a(n), A332498(n))} is related to the T-square fractal (see illustration in Links section).
We can iteratively build the set {(a(n), A332498(n))} as follows:
- for k = 0, 1, ..., X_{k+1} is obtained by adjoining to X_k:
- an horizontally mirrored copy of X_k to the right,
- and a vertically mirrored copy of X_k on the top,
